Wisdom: الْكَاتِمُ لِلْعِلْمِ غَيْرُ وَاثِقٍ بِالْإِصَابَةِ فِيهِ
enWisdom: The concealer of knowledge is not certain of being correct in it

Wisdom: تَعَلَّمْ عِلْمَ مَنْ يَعْلَمُ وَعَلِّمْ عِلْمَكَ مَنْ يَجْهَلُ فَإِذَا فَعَلْتَ ذَلِكَ عَلَّمَكَ مَا جَهِلْتَ وَانْتَفَعْتَ بِمَا عَلِمْتَ
enWisdom: Learn the knowledge of the one who knows, and teach your knowledge to the one who is ignorant, for if you do this, he will be teach you that which you are ignorant of and you will benefit [others] with what you have learnt

Wisdom: جَمَالُ الْعِلْمِ نَشْرُهُ وَثَمَرَتُهُ الْعَمَلُ بِهِ وَصِيَانَتُهُ وَضْعُهُ فِي أَهْلِهِ
enWisdom: The best of knowledge is that which gives benefit
Through knowledge, the station of forbearance is attained
The alms-tax of knowledge is granting it to the one who deserves it and exerting the self to act upon it

Wisdom: زَكَاةُ الْعِلْمِ بَذْلُهُ لِمُسْتَحِقِّهِ وَإِجْهَادُ النَّفْسِ فِي الْعَمَلِ بِهِ
enWisdom: The adornment of knowledge is forbearance

Wisdom: شُكْرُ الْعَالِمِ عَلَى عِلْمِهِ عَمَلُهُ بِهِ وَبَذْلُهُ لِمُسْتَحِقِّهِ
enWisdom: The gratitude of a scholar for his knowledge is [in] his acting upon it and his sharing it with the one who deserves it

Wisdom: عِلْمٌ لَا يَنْفَعُ كَدَوَاءٍ لَا يَنْجَعُ
enWisdom: Knowledge that is not useful is like a medicine that does not cure

Wisdom: كُنْ عَالِماً نَاطِقاً أَوْ مُسْتَمِعاً وَاعِياً وَإِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَكُونَ الثَّالِثَ
enWisdom: Be either a knowledgeable speaker or a keen listener, and beware of being the third type
One who acts against his knowledge, his crime and sin become grave

Wisdom: مِنَ الْمَفْرُوضِ عَلَى كُلِّ عَالِمٍ أَنْ يَصُونَ بِالْوَرَعِ جَانِبَهُ وَأَنْ يَبْذُلَ عِلْمَهُ لِطَالِبِهِ
enWisdom: It is necessary for every scholar to secure his sides with piety and to extend his knowledge to the one who seeks it

Wisdom: مَا أَخَذَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَلَى الْجَاهِلِ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ حَتَّى أَخَذَ عَلَى الْعَالِمِ أَنْ يُعَلِّمَ
enWisdom: Allah, the Glorified, did not make it incumbent upon the ignorant one to learn until He had made it incumbent upon the learned to teach
The basis of knowledge is acting upon it

Wisdom: إِنَّ النَّارَ لَا يَنْقُصُهَا مَا أُخِذَ مِنْهَا وَلَكِنْ يُخْمِدُهَا أَنْ لَا تَجِدَ حَطَباً وَكَذَلِكَ الْعِلْمُ لَا يُغْنِيهِ الِاقْتِبَاسُ وَلَكِنْ بُخْلُ الْحَامِلِينَ لَهُ سَبَبُ عَدَمِهِ
enWisdom: Indeed fire is not diminished by what is taken from it but is extinguished when it does not find firewood; similarly, knowledge is not depleted by being acquired but the miserliness of those who possess it is the cause of its absence
